title: The Mystery of the Missing Lunchbox

pages.text:
In the classroom, the teacher calls names.
"Ello Elephant," she says.
Ello raises his trunk and smiles.

At lunchtime, Ello opens his backpack.
His lunchbox is not there.
Ello looks surprised.

Ello checks his desk and his chair.
He looks carefully.
Still no lunchbox.

Fox, Rabbit, and Bear come to help.
"Letâ€™s find it," says Fox.
They all start looking together.

Fox says, "Maybe itâ€™s in the cubbies."
They check every cubby.
The lunchbox is not there.

Rabbit says, "Maybe you left it by the door."
They look near the classroom door.
Still no lunchbox.

Ello looks at the lunch table.
His name card is there.
But his lunchbox is missing.

Bear says, "What did we do before lunch?"
Ello thinks about the morning.
"We had art time," he says.

They walk to the art corner.
On the shelf, Ello sees it.
His lunchbox is there.

Ello laughs.
"I forgot it," he says.
Thinking step by step helped.
